## All Data Are Spatial!

::: {.incremental}

- Knowing the **where** of a phenomenon is fundamental
- **Spatial attributes** may reflect the nature of phenomena (think: [1854 Cholera Outbreak](https://miro.medium.com/v2/resize:fit:1266/format:webp/1*q-ewyMT0W6bqlghPXcTsrw.jpeg){target="_blank"})
- All data are spatial, but **not all data are *geo*spatial**
- Spatial data may not be [*geo*]spatially referenced

:::

## Geospatial Authorities:<br>Who creates, distributes, and maintains authoritative geodata?

- [Open Geospatial Consortium](https://www.ogc.org){target="_blank"}
  - Open data standards
  - Cloud-native Geospatial Technologies
- [The Federal Geographic Data Committee](https://www.fgdc.gov){target="_blank"}
  - Data standards for US Federal geospatial datasets
  - Metadata standards
  - [Create FGDC Compliant Metadata in ArcGIS Pro](https://pro.arcgis.com/en/pro-app/latest/help/metadata/create-fgdc-csdgm-metadata.htm){target="_blank"}

## Bottom Line

::: {.incremental}

- Use **open**, **accessible**, **authoritative** data
- Keep track of **data provenance**
  - Ensure metadata are *standards-compliant*
  - Record and report *operations* you perform on data
  - Archive new data in *federated repositories*

:::
